GGMncv 2.0.1
  • Reference

Compare Gaussian Graphical Models

Source: R/ggm_compare.R
ggm_compare.Rd

Compare Gaussian graphical models with the de-sparsified estimator of (Jankova and Van De Geer 2015) .

ggm_compare(object_1, object_2, method = "fdr", alpha = 0.05, ...)

Arguments

object_1

An object of class ggmncv
object_2

An object of class ggmncv
method

Character string. A correction method for multiple comparison (defaults to fdr). Can be abbreviated. See p.adjust.
alpha

Numeric. Significance level (defaults to 0.05).
...

Currently ignored.

Value

  • P_diff De-sparsified partial correlation matrix differences

  • adj Adjacency matrix based on the p-values.

  • uncorrected Uncorrected p-values

  • corrected Corected p-values

  • method The approach used for multiple comparisons

  • alpha Significance level

Examples

# data
Y1 <- MASS::mvrnorm(250, rep(0, 10), Sigma = diag(10))
Y2 <- MASS::mvrnorm(250, rep(0, 10), Sigma = diag(10))

# fit models
fit1 <- ggmncv(cor(Y1), n = nrow(Y1))
#> selecting lambda

# compare
compare_ggms <- ggm_compare(fit1, fit2)
